benchmark_details.name: AHaBench
benchmark_details.overview: AHaBench is a benchmark of 500 mental health-related prompts designed to diagnose affective hallucination in large language models (LLMs) with expert-informed reference responses.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and mitigate the risk of affective hallucination in LLMs and to provide resources for developing emotionally responsible AI systems.

data.source: Publicly available Reddit posts from mental health-related subreddits.
data.annotation: Crafted responses authored by subject matter experts to reflect optimal conversational behavior.

methodology.calculation: AHa Score is a seven-point scale (0-6) with higher values indicating stronger adherence to emotional safety.
methodology.interpretation: Scores of 3 or higher denote the absence of affective hallucination, while scores of 2 or lower indicate violations of emotional boundaries.
methodology.validation: Human agreement analyses confirm benchmark reliability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data used in AHaBench is sourced from publicly available, anonymized posts, adhering to privacy standards.
